response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (19 years old)", "high", "Being very young is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism due to less life experience and potential impulsivity."],
    ["Gender (male)", "medium", "Males statistically tend to face higher recidivism rates, though this alone is not determinative."],
    ["Race (Black)", "medium", "Historical and systemic factors may influence outcomes; however, race itself is a proxy and must be interpreted within context."],
    ["Criminal history (1 arrest, no conviction)", "medium", "A history of arrest, even without a conviction, indicates some prior involvement with the criminal justice system."],
    ["Education (no high school diploma/GED)", "high", "Lack of formal education is strongly linked to higher recidivism due to limited employment opportunities and socio-economic challenges."],
    ["Employment (held 2 jobs during the year)", "medium", "Limited employment stability may contribute to financial stress, although having any employment is somewhat protective."],
    ["Substance use (marijuana use in past four years)", "medium", "Recent drug use can be a risk factor for recidivism due to possible association with other risky behaviors."],
    ["Mental health (no recent depression)", "low", "The absence of recent depressive symptoms suggests stable mental health, which is generally protective."],
    ["Family background (lived with biological mother in a small household in rural area)", "low", "A stable family environment in a rural setting may be protective, with fewer negative peer influences."],
    ["Religious beliefs (believes God has nothing to do with personal fate)", "medium", "A lack of religiosity may indicate fewer community and social support networks, which can contribute to risk."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: Being very young is associated with a higher likelihood of recidivism due to less life experience and potential impulsivity.
Males statistically tend to face higher recidivism rates, though this alone is not determinative.
Historical and systemic factors may influence outcomes; however, race itself is a proxy and must be interpreted within context.
A history of arrest, even without a conviction, indicates some prior involvement with the criminal justice system.
Lack of formal education is strongly linked to higher recidivism due to limited employment opportunities and socio-economic challenges.
Limited employment stability may contribute to financial stress, although having any employment is somewhat protective.
Substance use (marijuana use in past four years)
Recent drug use can be a risk factor for recidivism due to possible association with other risky behaviors.
The absence of recent depressive symptoms suggests stable mental health, which is generally protective.
Family background (lived with biological mother in a small household in rural area)
A stable family environment in a rural setting may be protective, with fewer negative peer influences.
Religious beliefs (believes God has nothing to do with personal fate)
A lack of religiosity may indicate fewer community and social support networks, which can contribute to risk.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 19-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 6 feet 1 inch and weighs 165 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 3, in a rural area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
